page.title:
Introduction
Introduction
page.enlisting:
◆ Traditional geographic information systems provide spatial analysis tools, but the analyses are usually limited to 2.5 dimensions. ◆ New software tools are making it possible to integrate GIS with Java tools to provide a prototype of a ‘scientific GIS’ that can allow truly three-dimensional analyses.
◆ Traditional geographic information systems ◆ T r a d i t i o n a l

prototype of a ‘scientific GIS’ that can allow truly

page.title:
Test Case - mixed layer depth (MLD)
Test Case - mixed layer depth
(MLD)
page.normal_text:
The depth to which water is well mixed. This has ramifications for fish and planktonic organisms, also for nutrients.
The depth to which water is
well mixed. This has
ramifications for fish and
planktonic organisms, also
for nutrients. f o r
n u t r i e n t s .

Surface layer sits above the thermocline. Defined as the layer where the temperature is within 0.5° of the average surface temperature or where the potential density is within 0.125 of the surface average

thermocline. Defined as the layer
where the temperature is within
